mentions.context: Computer programming scripts used in this study are available on request.
Then, variants were called using GATK v4.1.2.0 [66], and only SNVs were retained.
org/) to the current assembly using RATT [62].

Adapters in the reads were removed using adapterremoval v2.1.7 [63], followed by mapping the reads against a reference genome with chromosome-sized scaffolds [64], using bowtie2 v2.3.4.1 with-very-sensitive-local preset [65].
The phylogenetic tree was visualized using iTOL v6 [71].
Principal component analysis was performed using plink v1.9 [73], and two groups according to the strains were identified.
A distance-based phylogenetic tree was reconstructed using FastME v2.1.6
Haplotype calling was performed from resulting bam files using GATK v4.1.2.0 [66].
We extracted a vcf file containing TPI gene from whole the nuclear genomic vcf file using tabix v1.10.2-3 [72].
Together with non-FAW COX1 sequences obtained from a previous study [68], a multiple sequence alignment was generated using MUSCLE v3.8.31 [69].

Adapters in the reads were removed using adapterremoval v2.1.7 [63], followed by mapping the reads against a reference genome with chromosome-sized scaffolds [64], using bowtie2 v2.3.4.1 with-very-sensitive-local preset [65].

The broken assemblies were concatenated using SALSA2 [59] or 3D-DNA [60], followed by gap filling with the 80X Illumina reads using SOAP-denovo2 Gap-Closer and with the PacBio reads using LR_GapCloser v1.1 [61].
